title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She told him, describing the moment when she stood before the fake McInnes in Barnhill, and how certain she was that it was by the same hand that did the larger painting he had just sold.

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: With  Lizzie at the wheel they made their way along the winding estate road that led to Barnhill.

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Lizzie had purloined one of the estate Land Rovers for the trip to Barnhill.

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Lizzie had offered them lunch, but Isabel had not wanted to impose, especially as Lizzie had cleared the following day to take them up to Barnhill.

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: 'Yes, at Barnhill, a house up at the top of the island.
